Final Projects 2025

Choose your project for Advanced Programming Spring 2025

üéØ Choose Your Final Project

Select one of the template projects below for your team (3-4 students), or propose a solo free-topic project. Your choice is final after Week 2 registration.

üìã Key Information

  • Team Size: 3-4 students for template projects, solo only for free-topic
  • Registration Deadline: Week 2 Friday 23:59 CET
  • Template Repos: Each project includes skeleton code, tests, and CI pipeline
  • Assessment: Repository (35%), Math/Algorithms (25%), Tests/CI (20%), Usability (10%), Report/Demo (10%)

üé® Solo Free-Topic Project

Solo Free-Topic Project

Individual Work

Requirements

  • Solo only: No team members allowed
  • Proposal required: One-paragraph proposal by Week 2 Friday 23:59 CET
  • No data science: Primary focus cannot be datasets/ML/statistics
  • Software engineering focus: Must demonstrate advanced programming concepts
üìù Proposal Guidelines ‚úâÔ∏è Contact for Advice

üìã Project Rules & Requirements

üèóÔ∏è Technical Standards

  • Python ‚â• 3.10, full CI/CD pipeline
  • ‚â•90% test coverage, mypy --strict
  • Black formatting, flake8 linting
  • Sphinx docs on GitHub Pages

üì¶ Deliverables

  • GitHub repo tagged v1.0.0
  • Technical report (4-6 pages PDF)
  • Live demo (15 minutes)
  • All three are mandatory

ü§ñ AI Tools Allowed

  • GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, Claude, etc.
  • Keep AI_LOG.md of major contributions
  • Be ready to explain AI-generated code
  • Academic honesty rules apply
